intro: Galium timeroyi subsp. timeroyi, commonly known as the Timor bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
